sentences: Seturam Shrestha (Nepali: सेतुराम श्रेष्ठ) (1891-1941) was a Nepalese musician, singer and composer.
He was an important figure in the development of modern music in Nepal at the beginning of the 20th century, and has been hailed as an Ustad.
In 1908, he became the first Nepalese artiste to record a song on gramophone disc.
Among the songs he recorded in a studio in Kolkata, India was the iconic Rajamati.
Janak Lal Shrestha, proprietor of Bhadrakali House, the main record store in Kathmandu then, sponsored the recording session.
Seturam has also been credited with pioneering ghazal music in Nepal.
Seturam was born in Asan Kamalachhi, Kathmandu to father Krishna Dhar and mother Hari Devi Shrestha.
